entry.title: Internship Interviews!
entry.content: This week I am interviewing for summer internships! I'm meeting with Wellbe, Zendesk and Bendyworks. All three are very different companies, and I'm so excited to find out more! I'll keep you posted!

entry.title: Group Project!
entry.content:
We started a new group project last night!! This such a great opportunity to apply all the skills we’ve learned and really shine!

So much progress has already been made. I really enjoyed organizing all of our thoughts on to a white board with words and pictures. I have naturally taken on a sort of project management role. I have so much fun creating a new flow through our social media platform, creating to-do lists on our trello board, and making a google drive for us to share. These tools will make the communication very efficient so we can make the most of these last 3 weeks.

The five of us call ourselves EveFy (our initials), but I like to call us EveFly :) The joke is that when Eve came into existence, it was the beginning of something great - like us ;) Half joking, because our team is made up of two boys and three girls. This will be fun!!

I’d love to talk all about our idea, but we wouldn’t want anyone to steal it! So let the suspense build, and in a few weeks we will share our app with you!

Next week we are having our very own job fair. Companies that have committed to mentoring us and taking interns for the summer will be at the event. They will pitch themselves to us and then we will have a “speed dating” style of interviews. From there, we will organize real interviews with those companies!

Graduation is approaching so fast! We will be having it at Dream Bank (on the square), at 2pm on Friday, May 29th. What a beautiful place to celebrate our achievement!

Not only am I excited for the internship, I am eager to jump into the design world. Attending Madison+UX in July will be a great launching point for my passion in design. So much to look forward to! What a long way we’ve come, and it’s only just begun.

entry.title: Wrapping Up
entry.content:
So, I’ve reached a place in my school work where I’m quite ahead. I have completed all my assignments for Javascript so far, though more assignments will be written soon. Now I’m learning a bit of jQuery, which has been a nice change up. I am also freshening up on my HTML and CSS skills so I can finish up my personal website. It’s been quite a few months since I’ve touched it, and I’m pretty rusty! But I’ve created a new mood board and wireframe, so at least I’ve got a new idea I’m working with.

I’m glad I have this time to get reacquainted with these languages - before I start interviewing for an internship at a local tech company! We will be having a personalized “job fair” in a couple weeks, which will allow us to meet representatives from different companies for which we will get to interview. I’m super excited for this next chapter of working for a real consulting company. This will be one step closer to doing what I truly aim for - graphic design! I’m so eager to create new things and learn how to do it well from professionals.

Although I’m thrilled for this new experience, I’m also realizing how incredibly short of time we have to prepare portfolios! Better get back to work!

entry.title: Baby Steps
entry.content: Today I began the process of applying to the Graphic Design Program at Madison College! I’ve got quite a lot of hoops to jump through - including applying for scholarships. I am so thankful for the strong support from my mentors and friends! This is going to be great!

entry.title: Failing.. And More Dreaming
entry.content:
Failing IS part of living.

I’ve learned that I WILL make mistakes. No question about it. In mistakes we grow, we learn, we succeed. Miss Annalise keeps encouraging me to just try. Accept that you will mess up. Whew, that’s kind of relieving.

My analytical side wondered if she wanted me to teach myself because my questions were dumb. Not true! My teacher has introduced me to a whole new practice. If I’m constantly relying on her to hold my hand and show me the way to do everything, how will I learn to troubleshoot problems on my own down the road? I am challenged to encourage myself, take risks, and embrace learning.

Of course I still need others. We all need each other to lean on, to sharpen our skills, to share victories and losses. However, only I can make choices in my life – choices to keep going, to keep searching for the solution, to keep trying no matter what.

And now about dreaming..

Recently, our class had a visitor from Adorable.io, a company I have fallen wildly in love with. Kevin shared how his love for people fuels his passion to work as a developer and designer. While sharing about his career path, Kevin shared one thing he wish he knew back then – that he would have been more focused. He did not have his eyes open to see opportunities presented to him – opportunities which could have launched him into success much earlier. After taking a round-a-bout way, he eventually landed a pretty sweet gig as the creative director at adorable. Now he encourages us to keep our eyes wide open and connect with people – for he believes that people are the essence of life.

Even today, I look at the opportunities before me. Annalise has offered to mentor me in graphic design, if that is something I truly want to dedicate myself to after graduation. I am honored by this invitation, and will seriously be considering it. I have tinkered around with is the idea of going into graphic design. Yet, having no experience whatsoever in that skill, I am timid to commit to such a complex field. But oh, how I want to learn! So, we will see what the new year brings, and perhaps I will begin working at a new dream!

Another cool opportunity I have discovered is the new “Hour of Code” program by Apple. I’m very new to working at Apple, so all I know is that kids are learning how to code. This simply amazes me that a young child can learn the same complicated stuff I am studying. Totally blown away! Who knows, maybe I can take part in teaching a class like this in the future!
